name: Maximum in Table
description:
An n × n table a is defined as follows: The first row and the first column
contain ones, that is: ai, 1 = a1, i = 1 for all i = 1, 2, ..., n. Each of the
remaining numbers in the table is equal to the sum of the number above it and
the number to the left of it. In other words, the remaining elements are
defined by the formula ai, j = ai - 1, j + ai, j - 1. These conditions define
all the values in the table. You are given a number n. You need to determine
the maximum value in the n × n table defined by the rules above. Input The
only line of input contains a positive integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 10) — the number of
rows and columns of the table. Output Print a single line containing a
positive integer m — the maximum value in the table. Examples Input 1 Output 1
Input 5 Output 70 Note In the second test the rows of the table look as
follows: 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 1, 3, 6, 10, 15, 1, 4, 10, 20,
35, 1, 5, 15, 35, 70.
